definition[0]: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving
example[0]: We dropped anchor a few yards offshore.
example[1]: The next morning, they weighed anchor  (=lifted the anchor) and began to move south again.
definition[1]: someone who reads the news on TV and introduces news reports
example[3]: Dan Rather, anchor of the CBC Evening News
definition[2]: someone or something that provides a feeling of support and safety
example[4]: Dad was the anchor of the family.
definition[3]: to lower the anchor on a ship or boat to hold it in one place
example[5]: Three tankers were anchored in the harbor.
definition[4]: to fasten something firmly so that it cannot move
example[6]: The shelves should be securely anchored to the wall.
explanation[0]: Anchor is usually passive in this meaning
